head.title: Progress? The True Revolution Lies Ahead

hedline.hl1: Progress? The True Revolution Lies Ahead

abstract.p: Patrick O'Leary letter, commenting on Paul Krugman's June 18 column, says genetic engineering will be the great transforming technology of the future; drawing

block.p: Paul Krugman writes that ''there is an ongoing debate among economists, engineers and futurists about whether we are really living in a golden age of technological progress.''
Paul Krugman writes that ''there is an ongoing debate among economists, engineers and futurists about whether we are really living in a golden age of technological progress.''

He then asks if the digital revolution measures up to the Industrial Revolution, or to the general standard of technological progress made in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. It does not, but the revolution that does is the revolution in biotechnology.
Genetic engineering, with all its different worries and promises, is the transforming technology of the future.

The ability to substantially alter the basic structure of life is the real revolution. The digital revolution, which has enabled so much of our biotech progress, is fundamentally just a backdrop to it.
